meanings: [명사] bias, [동사] be biased, be prejudiced, be lopsided
look at sth from a biased point of view

examples.korean: The findings of the report had been slanted in favour of the manufacturers. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 그 보고서의 결과는 제조 회사들에게 유리하게 편향된 것이었다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: The findings of the report had been slanted in favour of the manufacturers. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: a biased and slanted view of events 듣기 Add to Wordbook 사건에 대한 편향되고 편파적인 견해 Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: a biased and slanted view of events Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: accusations of political bias in news programmes 듣기 Add to Wordbook 뉴스 프로가 정치적으로 편향되어 있다는 비난 Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: accusations of political bias in news programmes Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: The book is heavily skewed towards American readers. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 그 책은 미국 독자들 쪽으로 심하게 편향되어 있다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: The book is heavily skewed towards American readers. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: Many people gathered and criticized the biased judicial system. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 많은 사람들이 모여 편향된 사법 제도를 비판했다. 절대어휘 5100
examples.english: Many people gathered and criticized the biased judicial system. Add to Wordbook
